BreakRiskMinorDesc:
These colonists are in a poor mood and may have a minor mental break at any time:

{0}
BreakRiskMajorDesc:
These colonists are in a very poor mood and may have a major mental break at any time:

{0}
BreakRiskExtremeDesc:
These colonists are critically stressed and may have an extreme (and possibly violent) mental break at any moment:

{0}
BreakRiskDescEnding:
Check these colonists' Needs tab to see what's bothering them.

To make colonists feel better, you can do things like make them fancy meals, give them more joy hours per day and nicer joy objects, place them in beautiful environments, have them drink and smoke, and much more.
ColonistsNeedRescueDesc:
These colonists are incapacitated on the ground:

{0}
Send another colonist to rescue them and carry them back to bed.

(To rescue, select another colonist, then right click on the victim and select Rescue.
NeedDefensesDesc:
You've been here some time and have probably been seen. Pirate raids will start soon.

You should prepare defenses, whether they're traps, sandbags, or turrets.
NeedDoctorDesc:
These colonists need medical care, but you have no healthy colonists assigned as doctors.

{0}
Assign a healthy colonist to the Doctor work type. If left untreated, wounds may never heal properly and may become permanent.
NeedMinerDesc:
You have designated some rocks to be mined, but no colonist has the Mining work type.

Assign a colonist the Mining work type.
NeedWardenDesc:
You have a prisoner, but no colonist has the Warden work type.

Assign a colonist the Warden work type.
LowFoodDesc:
You are dangerously low on food.

Full bars worth of food in storage: {0}
Colonists and prisoners getting food: {1}
Days worth of food in storage: {2}

Grow, buy, find, or kill some food.
LowMedicineDesc:
You only have {0} medications left in storage.

Buy more medicine from traders.
NoMedicineDesc:
You have no medicine left in storage.

Buy more medicine from traders.
NeedColonistBedsDesc:
You have more colonists than you have colonist beds. Someone will lack a place to sleep.

Either make more beds, or change a prisoner bed to a colonist bed.

If you have no resources, sleeping spots are free and can be placed instantly.
HunterLacksWeaponDesc:
A colonist is assigned as a hunter but does not have a ranged weapon.

They will not hunt until they are carrying a ranged weapon.
AlertTatteredApparelDesc:
These colonists are wearing tattered apparel, which is making them sad:

{0}
Get them some apparel that isn't so badly damaged.

You can tailor apparel at a tailoring table, or buy it from traders.
AlertUnhappyNudityDesc:
These colonists are nude and not happy about it:

{0}
Get them some clothes.

You can tailor apparel at a tailoring table, or buy it from traders.
StarvationDesc:
These colonists are starving:

{0}
Get them some food.
StarvationAnimalsDesc:
These colony animals are starving:

{0}
Get them some food.
ExhaustionDesc:
These colonists are exhausted and need rest:

{0}
Get them some rest. They'll need a bed marked for colonist use. Also, make sure they're not drafted.
NeedFoodHopperDesc:
You have a nutrient dispenser with no hopper next to it.

To work, paste dispensers must draw from an adjacent hopper filled with raw food.

Build a hopper adjacent to the dispenser.
NeedMealSourceDesc:
You have no way of preparing proper meals from raw food.

Build a stove, campfire, or nutrient dispenser.

(It cannot be in a prison cell, otherwise colonists cannot use it.)
NeedJoySourceDesc:
Your colonists need to fulfill their joy need, but you haven't built any joy sources.

Help them by building a horseshoes pin, chess table, or other joy source.
NeedBatteriesDesc:
You have a solar or wind generator, but no batteries. This means you'll lose power every time the sun goes down or the wind calms.

Build a battery or two to guarantee sustained power.
BrawlerHasRangedWeaponDesc: One of your colonists has the Brawler personality trait, but is carrying a ranged weapon. This will make them very unhappy.
ShieldUserHasRangedWeaponDesc: One of your colonists has a shield belt and is carrying a ranged weapon. They will not be able to fire their weapon through the shield (except at targets who are already touching them).
NeedResearchProjectDesc:
You have the equipment to do research but have not selected a project.

Open the research menu and select a project.
ColonistsIdleDesc:
These colonists are wandering idly:

{0}
You should probably find them something productive to do.
ColonistNeedsTreatmentDesc:
These colonists need medical treatment. Without it, they may die of their wounds, or their wounds may become permanent.

{0}
Treat them by sending them to a medical bed.

(First, assign a medical bed by selecting it and toggling it into a medical bed. Then, select the wounded colonists and right-click on the medical bed to make them a patient.)
AlertHypothermiaDesc:
These colonists are suffering from hypothermia.

{0}
Make sure their clothing is appropriate for the season and that indoor spaces are properly heated.
PatientsAwaitingMedicalOperationDesc:
These patients await medical operation:

{0}
Make sure you have all necessary medical tools and a free doctor available.
FireInHomeAreaDesc: There is a fire in the home area.
PawnsWithLifeThreateningDiseaseDesc:
People are at risk of death because of severe illness:

{0}
Make sure that they get the best medical possible.
PawnsWithLifeThreateningDiseaseAmputatio:
People are at risk for death because of severe illness:

{0}
If possible, consider amputating or replacing infected limbs in order to keep colonists alive.
BilliardsNeedsSpaceDesc:
One of your billiards table is adjacent to an obstruction that will prevent colonists from using it.

A billiards table needs clear space around it on all sides to be usable.
HunterHasShieldAndRangedWeapon: Hunter has shield and ranged weapon
HunterHasShieldAndRangedWeaponDesc:
One of your hunters is using a ranged weapon and wearing a shield belt which prevents shooting at range.

They won't be able to hunt unless the shield is removed.
NeedWarmClothesDesc1: At least {0} of your colonists will lack warm clothes when the cold season comes.
NeedWarmClothesDesc1All: All of your colonists will lack warm clothes when the cold season comes.
NeedWarmClothesDesc2:
The outdoor temperature is going to reach {0}.

You can tailor warm clothes at the tailoring bench, or buy them from traders.
ImmobileCaravanDesc:
One of your caravans is immobile because it carries too much.

You can make the caravan mobile again by abandoning some items in the ITEMS tab.
MainPageCredit: A colony simulator by Tynan Sylvester
DateReadoutTip:
Days passed since your arrival: {0}

The year is divided into 4 quadrums of {3} days each.
Current quadrum: {4}

There are {1} days in each season.
Current season: {2}
DesignatorCancelDesc: Cancel designated building, mining, hauling, harvesting, and all other designations.
DesignatorCutPlantsDesc: Marks plants to be cut and destroyed. The plant will be completely removed, and any food or resource yield will be harvested.
DesignatorDeconstructDesc: Deconstruct this and reclaim part of its resources.
DesignatorUninstallDesc: Uninstall this so it can be moved, sold, or installed somewhere else.
DesignatorHarvestDesc: Marks plants to be harvested for their food or other products.
DesignatorHarvestWoodDesc: Marks trees to be chopped down for wood.
DesignatorHaulThingsDesc: Mark rock chunks and other items to be hauled to dumping areas. Not needed for things like food or corpses, which are always haulable.
MustHaulHaulables: Can only designate haulable but non-always-hauled things (like rock chunks).
DesignatorHuntDesc: Mark animals to be hunted by your hunters.
DesignatorMineDesc: Designate areas of rock to be mined out.
DesignatorSmoothFloorDesc: Designate rough stone terrain to be smoothed.
DesignatorPlanDesc: Place planning designations. These don't do anything except help you plan future expansions.
DesignatorAreaHomeExpandDesc: Colonists will repair buildings, clean floors, and extinguish fires only in the home area.
DesignatorAreaHomeClearDesc: Removes a home area. Colonists will no longer clean, repair, or extinguish fires here.
DesignatorAreaBuildRoofExpandDesc: Colonists will build roofs in this area.
DesignatorAreaBuildRoofClearDesc: Remove the area where colonists will build roofs. Existing roofs will remain, but colonists won't build more.
DesignatorAreaNoRoofExpandDesc: Colonists will remove roofs in this area (except overhead mountain, which cannot be removed).
DesignatorAreaNoRoofClearDesc: Removes no-roof area, so colonists will no longer remove roofs.
DesignatorAreaSnowClearExpandDesc: Create a area which colonists will try to keep clear of snow.
DesignatorAreaSnowClearClearDesc: Removes a snow clearing area. Colonists will no longer try to keep this area clear of snow.
DesignatorExpandAreaAllowedDesc:
Expand an allowed area.

Allowed areas are defined areas you can assign to colonists. Colonists will not accept work or fulfill their needs outside their allowed area.
DesignatorClearAreaAllowedDesc:
Clear cells from an allowed area.

Allowed area are defined areas you can assign to colonists. Colonists will not accept work or fulfill their needs outside their allowed area.
DesignatorGrowingZoneDesc: Create a zone where your colonists will try to grow a certain kind of plant.
DesignatorZoneCreateStorageResourcesDesc:
Create a stockpile where your colonists will store resources.
This tool can also expand any existing stockpile.
DesignatorZoneCreateStorageDumpingDesc:
Create a stockpile where your colonists will store junk.
This tool can also expand any existing stockpile.
DesignatorZoneDeleteDesc: Remove zones, like stockpile zones or growing zones.
DesignatorClaimDesc: Claim neutral structures for the colony, including ancient ruins and abandoned siege bases. Claimed structures can be repaired and maintained by your colonists.
DesignatorRemoveFloorDesc: Remove floors to reveal the terrain underneath.
DesignatorStripDesc: Strip apparel from corpses and the wounded.
DesignatorRearmTrapDesc: Rearm a sprung trap so it can be triggered again.
InteractionSpotOutOfBounds: Interaction spot is out of bounds.
InteractionSpotWillBeBlocked: Interaction spot will be blocked by {0}.
TerrainBeingSmoothed: The terrain is already marked for smoothing.
TerrainCannotSupport: The terrain here cannot support this.
StatsReport_MarketValueFromStuffsAndWork: Base market value calculated is from construction materials and work amount.
StatsReport_MeleeDPSExplanation:
Stat is displayed in the following format:
DPS ( Melee damage / Cooldown in seconds / Melee hit chance )

DPS = Melee damage * Melee hit chance / Cooldown in seconds
FactionGreetingHostile: {0} hurls some epithets into the microphone and disconnects.
FactionGreetingWary: {0} greets {1} warily and asks HIS business.
FactionGreetingWarm: {0} greets {1} warmly and asks how the colony fares.
ChooseTraderKind: {0} asks what kind of trade caravan you want.
TraderSent: {0} agrees to send you a trade caravan. It will arrive within a few days.
MilitaryAidConfirmMutualEnemy: {0} will not help you fight other factions who are not their enemies. This includes some who are currently threatening you, {1}. Do you still want to call for aid?
MilitaryAidSent: {0} agrees to send fighters to help you.
GameUpdatedToNewVersionInitial: RimWorld has been updated from version {0} to version {1}.
GameUpdatedToNewVersionSavesIncompatible: This may cause saved games and mods from the old version to stop working.
GameUpdatedToNewVersionSavesCompatible: Saved games from the old version should be compatible, however some mods may stop working.
GameUpdatedToNewVersionNonSteam: Since this is a DRM-free copy, you can install the game twice in two different folders, to be able to play both old and new versions.
GameUpdatedToNewVersionSteam:
If you wish to continue with the old version, you can opt in using Steam's "Betas" feature.

1. In the Steam library, right-click RimWorld.
2. Click Properties.
3. Click the Betas tab.
4. Select the version you want from the drop-down menu.

Old versions will be likely removed from this list eventually - we just didn't want to cut off games in progress.

Note that if mod authors update their mods for a new game version, they'll probably stop working on an old version. You may want to turn off automatic updates to prevent this.
RecoveredFromErrorsDialogTitle: Recovered from incompatible or corrupted mods errors
RecoveredFromErrorsText:
It seems that some of the active mods were causing errors.

They were incompatible with each other, designed for a different version of RimWorld, or corrupted.

All mods have been disabled and can be activated again in the mods dialog.
ErrorWhileLoadingAssets: An error occurred while loading game assets. See error log for more information.
ErrorWhileLoadingAssets_ModsInfo: The game is currently running with custom mods - they may or may not cause these problems.
ErrorWhileGeneratingMap: An error occurred while generating a new map. See error log for more information.
ErrorWhileLoadingMap: An error occurred while loading a map. See error log for more information.
ModsChanged: The mod list has changed. The game will now restart automatically.
FailedToRestart:
Something went wrong while restarting the game. The game can't fully unload modified code from deactivated mods, so code from deactivated mods may still be active.

It's recommended that you quit and restart the game now to load all mods cleanly.
SteamClientMissing:
Could not initialize Steam API. Possible causes:

-Steam is not running.
-Launched from outside Steam without steam_appid.txt in place.
-Running with different privileges than Steam client (e.g. "as administrator").

In most cases, rebooting your computer will fix this problem.

You can play anyway, but no Steam stats will be recorded and Steam features won't be available.
SaveIsFromDifferentGameVersion:
We are running version {0} but the save data is from {1}, which is a different version entirely.

Trying to load this data will probably not work.
SaveIsFromDifferentGameBuild:
We are running version {0} but the save data is from {1}, which is a different build.

Trying to load this data should still work.
SaveIsFromThisGameBuild: Save data was saved with our game version and should work without issue.
SaveIsUnknownFormat: Save data is in an unknown format and almost certainly will not load properly.
ProblemSavingFile:
There was a problem saving the file {0}:

{1}

See error log for more information.
NamePlayerFactionMessage: {0} thinks that you should give your faction a name. What should your faction be called?
PlayerFactionGainsName: Your faction is now known as {0}.
NamePlayerFactionBaseMessage: Since it looks like you'll be here for a while, {0} thinks that you should give this community a name. What should the local community be called?
PlayerFactionBaseGainsName: This community is now known as {0}.
NamePlayerFactionBaseMessage_NameFaction: Since it looks like you'll be here for a while, {0} also thinks that you should give this community a name. What should this local community be called?
PlayerFactionAndBaseGainsName: Your faction is now known as {0}, and this community is now known as {1}.
SaveGameIncompatibleWarningText:
This game was saved with game version {0}
We are running game version {1}

Loading this save may cause bugs and crashes.
WorldFileVersionMismatch:
World file was generated with game version {0}
We are running game version {1}

Loading this world may cause bugs and crashes. You should probably generate a new world from scratch.
FileIncompatibleWarning:
This file was saved with game version {0}
We are running game version {1}

Loading this file may cause bugs and crashes.
ModsMismatchWarningText:
This file was saved with a different set of mods active than those we are currently running. This may or may not cause problems, depending on exactly what these mods do.

File was saved with (in this order):

{0}

We are running with (in this order):

{1}
ConfirmResolutionChange:
You've changed your screen settings. Do the new ones work okay?

Auto-reverting in {0}...
ResearchMenuWithoutBench:
Until you build a RESEARCH BENCH, your colonists will not actually be able to do research.

However, you can still look at research projects now.
MapTemperatureDangerWarning: Warning: You will be landing in a frozen environment. It may be hard or nearly impossible to survive. If you are not intending to face an extreme challenge, choose a different site or season.
MapSizePerformanceWarning: Warning: Performance may degrade at larger map sizes. Ludeonicrous size is untested and will almost certainly not play well.
PermadeathModeInfo:
In permadeath mode, you get one save file and can only save when quitting the game. You cannot reload the game to fix mistakes, and when the colony dies, that's it.

This is the way RimWorld was meant to be played, with every dramatic turn - whether tragic or hopeful - played out to full impact.
RecipeCannotHaveTargetCount: (This recipe cannot have a target count because it has multiple or unpredictable products.)
BillRequiresMayVary: Note: small-volume ingredients like gold require {0}x as much.
ThisIsSmallVolume: This is a small-volume ingredient. This means that each 'unit' is only 1/{0} as much as a normal-volume ingredient. So, to fill the same ingredient requirement, you'll need {0}x as much as usual.
GrowingTimeDesc: Plants only grow for part of the day, and only when lit. This statistic measures the time the plant needs to spend actually growing to reach full size. The actual real growing time will generally be about twice as long. Low temperatures also slow plant growth.
CoverEffectivenessExplanation: How effective this is when used as cover in a gunfight. Higher percentages will block more shots.
WildnessExplanation: Wilder creatures are naturally more difficult to tame, train, and handle.
AnimalFilthRateExplanation:
Animals produce filth when moving around on constructed floors. This is the average amount of such filth produced per {0} cells walked by this creature.

Larger or less pet-like animals produce more filth.
PackAnimalExplanation: Whether this animal is appropriate to use to carry items in a caravan over long distances.
BuyPriceDesc: Price you pay to buy this.
SellPriceDesc: Price you receive for selling this.
PriceTypeDesc: For this item, this price is {0}.
ColonyCount:
How many of this item the colony has ready to trade.

You can only sell items to orbital traders if they are outdoors and near an orbital trade beacon.
TraderCount: How many of this item the trader has to trade.
YourTradeableSilverTip: You can only trade with silver that is near an orbital trade beacon and not under a roof.
TraderWillNotTrade: Trader is not willing to trade this.
NegotiatorTalkingImpaired:
Your negotiator {0} cannot talk properly because of poor health.

This will affect trade prices.

Consider using a healthier negotiator.
ConfirmTraderShortFunds: Trader has insufficient silver to fully cover this transaction.  Proceed anyways?
TradeMassUsageTooltip: The resulting mass usage and mass capacity.
FormCaravanColonyThingCountTip: How many of this item the colony has ready to give to the caravan.
CaravanMustHaveAtLeastOneColonist: You must assign at least one non-downed colonist.
CaravanCouldNotFindExitSpot: Could not find any valid exit location.
CaravanCouldNotFindReachableExitSpot: Warning: some of the assigned colonists are unable to reach the exit location.
CaravanPawnIsUnreachable: {0} is unreachable by any of the assigned colonists.
CaravanItemIsUnreachableSingle: None of the assigned colonists are able to reach the {0}.
CaravanItemIsUnreachableMulti: None of the assigned colonists are able to reach {0}x {1}.
TooBigCaravanMassUsage: The caravan is not able to carry that much.
CaravanMassUsageTooltip:
Current mass usage and mass capacity.

Mass usage includes the assigned caravan supplies as well as the colonists' current equipment.

You will not be able to send the caravan if the mass usage exceedes capacity.
DaysWorthOfFoodInfoRot: {0} days worth of food, rot in {1} days
InfiniteDaysWorthOfFoodInfo: Will never run out of food
DaysWorthOfFoodTooltip:
An approximate number of days before the caravan runs out of food.

This takes into account both human and animal food, and shows the worst case scenario. This means that after this many days, at least one person or animal will be out of food.
DaysWorthOfFoodTooltip_CanEatLocalPlants: Based on the current season, temperature, and surroundings we assume that it WILL be possible for herbivore animals to eat local plants. This however can change at any time.
DaysWorthOfFoodTooltip_CantEatLocalPlant: Based on the current season, temperature, and surroundings we assume that it will NOT be possible for herbivore animals to eat local plants. This however can change at any time.
DaysWorthOfFoodWarningDialog:
Your caravan only has {0} days worth of food and will become hungry very quickly.

Are you sure you want to form this caravan?
DaysWorthOfFoodWarningDialog_NoFood:
Your caravan has no food and will become hungry very quickly.

Are you sure you want to form this caravan?
CaravanFoodWillRotSoonWarningDialog:
A large part of the assigned food will rot soon.

Are you sure you want to form this caravan?
NoExitDirectionForCaravanChosen: You must choose an exit direction for the caravan.
DaysUntilRotTip: The number of days until this item starts to rot based on the average temperature in this area.
CaravanFormationProcessStarted: Your colonists will now take the assigned items and leave the area as soon as possible.
SourceCaravanMustHaveAtLeastOneColonist: You must leave at least one non-downed colonist.
SplitCaravanThingCountTip: How many of this item the caravan has ready to give to the new caravan.
SplitCaravanMassUsageTooltip: Current mass usage and mass capacity.
TooBigTransportersMassUsage: The assigned people and items are too heavy for the transport pods.
CantSendEmptyTransportPods: You can't send empty transport pods.
TransporterItemIsUnreachableSingle: There is no path between the transport pods and the {0}.
TransporterItemIsUnreachableMulti: There is no path between the transport pods and {0}x {1}.
TransportersMassUsageTooltip:
Current mass usage and mass capacity.

You will not be able to send the transport pods if the mass usage exceedes capacity.
HistoryUploadMessage: Do you want to upload your gameplay data records to RimWorld server in order to help developers balance the game? If you agree, your data will be uploaded every {0} days (and in some other rare cases like the end of the game). Privacy preferences can be changed later in the options menu.
HistoryUploadMessagePlayerName: Even though history is sent anonymously, you can attach your name.
HistoryUploadNo: Do not allow uploading gameplay data
HistoryUploadNoOnce: Do not upload this time, ask me later
DrugPolicyInUse: Drugs policy is in use by {0}.
DrugUsageColumnDesc: How the drug is allowed to be used.
FrequencyColumnDesc: How often the colonists should try to take this drug.
MoodThresholdColumnDesc: The colonists will take this drug only if their mood level is below this threshold.
JoyThresholdColumnDesc: The colonists will take this drug only if their joy level is below this threshold.
TakeToInventoryColumnDesc: An amount of the drug to pick up extra when gathering it for consumption, in order to avoid having to visit the drug stockpile every time.
DrugUsageTipForAddiction:
For addictions

Use this drug to feed already-established addiction needs.

Even if disabled, some characters with specific traits, or on mental breaks, may use the drug anyway.
DrugUsageTipForJoy:
For joy

Use this drug for joy and social purposes.

Even if disabled, some characters with specific traits, or on mental breaks, may use the drug anyway.
DrugUsageTipScheduled:
Scheduled

Use this drug on a defined schedule, when specific conditions are met.
NoGrowerCanPlant:
{0} requires {1} skill in Growing to sow.

None of your non-downed growers have this skill, so this plant will not be sown.
ConfirmAbandonHomeWithColonyPawns:
Some of your colonists or animals are in this area. Are you sure you want to abandon it?

The following people and animals will be left behind:

{0}
ConfirmAbandonHomeNegativeThoughts: Abandoning {0} will cause the following people to get the following thoughts:
ConfirmLeavePrisonersOrAnimalsBehind:
There are still some prisoners or animals left in this area and this is the only caravan they can join at the moment.

If you move your caravan, they won't be able to leave the area until you are back. The prisoners will start escaping, while the animals will keep waiting for you.

If you decide to wait, they will try to join your caravan as soon as possible.

Are you sure you want to move your caravan?
ConfirmAbandonPawnDialog: Do you really want to abandon {0}?
ConfirmAbandonPawnDialog_EquipmentAndApp: {0} will take the following items with HIM:
ConfirmAbandonPawnDialog_AllColonistsTho: All colonists will get the following thoughts:
ConfirmAbandonPawnDialog_IndividualThoug: Abandoning {0} will cause the following people to get the following thoughts:
ConfirmSendNotCompletelyLoadedPods: Pod group isnâ€™t completely loaded. {0} is missing. Launch anyway?
NoEmptyPlaceLower: no empty, accessible spot configured to store it
NoEmptyGraveLower: no empty grave configured to store it
TheOnlyAvailableFoodIsInStorageOfHigherP: available food is in storage of higher priority
NoPrisonerBed: No reachable, un-reserved, enclosed prisoner-marked bed in safe temperature.
NoNonPrisonerBed: No reachable, un-reserved non-prisoner bed in safe temperature.
NoAnimalBed: No reachable, un-reserved animal bed in safe temperature.
CannotCarryToExit: Cannot carry {0} and leave the area
CannotPrioritizeResearch: Cannot prioritize (research is a long-term task)
CannotPrioritizeForbiddenOutsideAllowedA: Cannot prioritize ({0} is outside allowed area)
CommandForbiddenDesc: Forbidden - colonists will not interact with this.
CommandNotForbiddenDesc: Not forbidden - colonists may interact with this.
CommandDesignateTogglePowerDesc: Designate this thing to have power toggled. A colonist will come soon to flick the switch.
CommandTryReconnectDesc: Try to connect to a different power net within my connection radius. This is useful if I'm connected to an unpowered net but there is a powered net nearby.
CommandGatherSpotToggleDescActive: Active - colonists will gather around this object.
CommandGatherSpotToggleDescInactive: Inactive - colonists will not gather around this object.
CommandToggleDraftDesc:
Toggle military draft.

Drafted people take orders and fight. They will not work, eat, or rest.
CommandAllowFiringDesc:
Toggle allow firing.

When disabled, this character will not automatically shoot at ranged targets. Does not affect melee combat.
CommandClearPrioritizedWorkDesc: Clear any prioritized work you assigned. The character will go back to their usual self-directed activities.
CommandBedSetOwnerDesc: Assign this bed to be owned by a specific colonist.
CommandGraveAssignColonistDesc: Assign this grave to be owned by a specific colonist.
CommandBedSetForPrisonersDesc: Whether beds in this room should be used by prisoners.
CommandBedSetForPrisonersFailOutdoors: Only beds in enclosed spaces can be set for prisoners.
CommandBedSetAsMedicalDesc: Whether this bed is for medical use.
TurningOnPrisonerBedWarning:
Turning on prisoner mode affects the whole room (since prisoners and colonists cannot sleep in the same room).

These people will lose ownership of their beds:
TurningOffPrisonerBedWarning:
Turning off prisoner mode affects the whole room (since prisoners and colonists cannot sleep in the same room).

These people will lose ownership of their beds:
AreYouSure: Are you sure you want to do this?
CommandCopyZoneSettingsDesc: Copy this zone's settings to the clipboard so you can paste them onto another zone.
CommandPasteZoneSettingsDesc: Overwrite this zone's settings with those previously copied to the clipboard.
CommandAllowSowDesc: When disabled, colonists will never sow plants in this zone. They will still harvest.
CommandSetForceAttackTargetDesc: Sets a target that this turret must attack continuously as long as it can.
CommandStopForceAttackDesc: Stops force-attacking and allows the turret to fire as it wishes.
CommandShipLaunchDesc: Start the ship launch sequence with the current configuration.
CommandShipLaunchReportDesc: Show a readiness report about the ship's launch capability.
CommandPodEjectDesc: Wake up the cryptosleeper and eject them.
CommandToggleDoorForbidDesc: When a door is forbidden, colonists and allies will not go through it. This doesn't affect how enemies or animals interact with the door.
CommandToggleDoorHoldOpenDesc: When active, your colonists will not close the door after passing through.
CommandResetTempDesc: Reset the target temperature to room temperature.
CommandInstallDesc: This item is currently packaged up for storage and transport. Use this command to install this item in a final location.
CommandReinstallDesc: Designate this item to be uninstalled and reinstalled somewhere else.
CommandMakeBeaconStockpileDesc: Create a stockpile around this building exactly matching the shape of the beacon's launch radius.
CommandSunLampMakeGrowingZoneDesc: Create a growing zone around this building exactly matching the shape of the lamp's light radius.
CommandAutoRearmDesc: If this is on, this trap will automatically be designated for rearming when it springs.
CommandReleaseAnimalsDesc: While this is on, mastered animals are sent forth to attack distant targets. While it is off, they remain near and guard the master.
CommandSquadAttackDesc: Order selected colonists to attack designated target.
CommandSelectPlantToGrowDesc: Determine which plant should be sown here.
CommandBuildCopyDesc: Build a copy of this building.
CommandFormCaravanDesc: Form a group of colonists able to travel to new areas. The colonists will gather all the assigned supplies and accompanying animals, leave their current area, and await further orders.
CommandReformCaravanDesc: Reform a group of colonists. The colonists will leave their current area and await further orders.
CommandReformCaravanFailHostilePawns: There are still some enemies in this area.
CommandSplitCaravanDesc: Split this caravan into two. The caravans can be later merged back into one as long as they are close to each other.
CommandSettleDesc: Settle in this area. Your colonists will enter this area and you will be able to start building a new home.
CommandSettleFailOtherWorldObjectsHere: Your caravan must be the only object on this tile in order to settle the area.
CommandSettleFailAlreadyHaveBase: Your faction can only have one base.
CommandSettleFailFactionBaseAdjacent: Settlements cannot be directly adjacent to each other.
CommandSettleFailNoColonists: There isn't anybody there to claim the area.
CommandSettleFailEnemies: There are enemies in this area.
CommandAbandonHomeDesc: Abandon this area. The area will become inaccessible and you will not be able to return here ever again. After abandoning your home, you will be able to order one of your caravans to settle in a new area.
CommandAbandonHomeFailAllColonistsThere: All of your colonists are there.
CommandTradeFailNoNegotiator: There isn't any conscious, not broken negotiator.
CommandFulfillTradeOfferDesc: Fulfill the settlement's request for goods and claim your reward.
CommandFulfillTradeOfferFailInsufficient: Your caravan must have {0} to fulfill this trade offer.
CommandTakeOffDesc: Get on board the ship and escape the planet.
CommandTakeOffConfirmation:
Are you sure you want to launch the ship?

Everyone in this area will escape the planet. Everyone else will be left behind.
CommandSetTargetFuelLevelDesc: Set the target fuel level. Colonists will attempt to fill this up to the target fuel level.
CommandCancelLoadDesc: Cancel loading this with people or items and eject everything already loaded.
CommandLaunchGroupDesc: Initiates the targeting process for launching a group of transport pods. The next step is choosing a target. The pods will fly and land together.
CommandLaunchGroupFailNotConnectedToFuel: Some transport pods in this loading group are not connected to a fueling port.
CommandLaunchGroupFailNoFuel: Some pod launchers in this group have no fuel.
CommandLaunchGroupFailUnderRoof: Some pod launchers are under a roof.
CommandLoadTransporterDesc: Defines the selected transporter(s) as a launch group. Opens the loading dialog so you can decide who and what should be loaded inside.
CommandLoadTransporterFailNotConnectedTo: The transport pod is not connected to a fueling port.
CommandLoadTransporterFailNoFuel: The pod launcher has no fuel.
CommandSelectPreviousTransporterDesc: Select previous transport pod in this launch group.
CommandSelectAllTransportersDesc: Select all transport pods in this launch group.
CommandSelectNextTransporterDesc: Select next transport pod in this launch group.
CommandDesignateOpenCloseVentDesc: Designate this vent to be opened or closed. A colonist will come soon to perform the task.
AnimalInsanitySingle: A local {0} has gone mad. It will attack everyone it sees.
AnimalInsanityMultiple:
Some sort of psychic wave has swept over the landscape. Your colonists are okay, but...

It seems many of the {0}s in the area have been driven insane.
CropBlight: A mysterious blight has destroyed your crops.
EnemyRaidWalkIn: A group of {0} from {1} have arrived nearby.
EnemyRaidEdgeDrop: A group of {0} from {1} have arrived in drop pods nearby.
EnemyRaidCenterDrop: A group of {0} from {1} have dropped in right on top of you!
EnemyRaidLeaderPresent: One of the {0} - {1}, is the leader of the faction.
FriendlyRaidWalkIn: A group of friendly {0} from {1} have arrived nearby.
FriendlyRaidEdgeDrop: A group of friendly {0} from {1} have dropped in from orbit nearby.
FriendlyRaidCenterDrop: A group of friendly {0} from {1} have dropped from orbit right on top of you!
FriendlyRaidLeaderPresent: One of the {0} - {1}, is the leader of the faction.
RefugeePodCrash:
You've detected an escape pod crashing hard nearby.

If anyone survived the impact, they'll be badly wounded.

You can rescue them and send them on their way. Or, capture them for recruitment or slavery purposes.
CargoPodCrash:
You have detected a cluster of cargo pods crashing nearby.

Perhaps you'll find something useful in the wreckage.
ShortCircuit:
A fault in {0} has caused a short circuit.

All {1} Wd of energy in the connected batteries has been discharged in an electrical explosion.
ShortCircuitWasLarge: This large amount of power has created an explosion of considerable size.
ShortCircuitWasHuge: That really is a huge explosion. Wow.
TraderArrival:
A trade ship is passing nearby.

They are known as {0}. They are a {1}.
SingleTravelerPassing: A {0} from {1} is passing by. HECAP is named {2}.
GroupTravelersPassing: A group of travelers from {0} are passing by.
SingleVisitorArrives:
A {0} from {1} is visiting the colony.

HECAP is named {2}.{3}{4}
SingleVisitorArrivesTraderInfo: HECAP seems to have a few items to trade.
SingleVisitorArrivesLeaderInfo: HECAP is the leader of the faction.
GroupVisitorsArrive: A group from {0} are visiting the colony.{1}{2}
GroupVisitorsArriveTraderInfo: They seem to have a few items to trade.
GroupVisitorsArriveLeaderInfo: One of the visitors - {0}, is the leader of the faction.
WandererJoin: A {0} named NAME has arrived and is joining the colony. HECAP is a {1}.
ManhunterPackArrived:
A pack of man-hunting {0}s have entered the area. They will roam the region, hunting for humanoid flesh.

They can't pass doors, so if you stay behind walls you should be safe. They won't attack inactive turrets, so turn your turrets off if you want to save them.

They'll leave the area in a few days.
MessageAnimalInsanityPulse: The ancient structure has emitted a psychic pulse that has driven nearby animals mad.
LetterShipPartDroveColonistInsane: The crashed ship part has emitted a focused psychic pulse that has driven colonist {0} insane.
LetterPsychicDroneLevelIncreased: The crashed ship part is now emanating a more powerful kind of psychic drone. Every humanlike in the area now feels more disturbed, terrified, and paranoid.
LetterAgentRevealed:
{0} has been revealed as an agent of your enemy {1}.

They are attempting to escape now.
LetterIncidentPsychicDrone:
Every colonist of the {0} gender winces in pain!

Some distant engine of hatred is stirring. It is projecting a powerful psychic drone over this entire region, on a frequency that only seems to affect the {0} gender. For a few days, some people's mood will be quite a bit worse.
LetterIncidentPsychicSoothe:
Every colonist of the {0} gender smiles with contentment!

Some distant engine of happiness is stirring. It is projecting a powerful psychic drone over this entire region, on a frequency that only seems to affect the {0} gender. For a few days, some people's mood will be quite a bit better.
BeaversArrived:
A group of hungry alphabeavers has just arrived.

Try to eliminate them before they decimate every last tree in the region.
RefugeeChasedInitial:
A {1} named {0} calls you from nearby. HECAP is being chased by {2} from {3}!

HECAP begs for safety and offers to join your colony. Biologically, HE is {4} years old.

Be warned - if you accept, you'll have to fight off the {2} on HIS tail.
RefugeeChasedRejected: {0} screams in panic through the tinny speaker before you cut off the transmission.
LetterAnimalSelfTameAndNameNumerical: {0} has become tame. It is now designated {1}.
LetterAnimalSelfTameAndName: {0} has become tame. Colonists have decided to name it {1}.
LetterFarmAnimalsWanderIn:
A group of {0}s, abandoned or lost, have wandered into the area.

They seem accustomed to human contact and are joining the colony.
LetterThrumboPasses:
A small herd of thrumbos have wandered into the area.

Peaceful by nature, these rare creatures are extremely dangerous when confronted. Some traders are willing to pay a lot of money for their precious leather and horn.

Thrumbos will leave the area in a few days.
LetterTraderCaravanArrival:
A caravan from {0} is approaching. They are a {1}.

They will hang around the colony for a few days before leaving. You can attack them - but this will anger their faction!
LetterBuildingBrokenDown: One of your machines ({0}) has broken down. It won't work until a colonist with the Repair work type goes and fixes it.
RansomDemand:
{1} contacts you on radio. They are holding former colonist {0} for ransom.

They're willing to release HIM back to you in exchange for {2} silver.
JourneyOffer:
A friendly AI from your past named Charlon Whitestone has sent you a message!

He reveals that he has a starship hidden on this planet, and sends you its world coordinates.

If you travel to the ship, Charlon will take you off this rim world, to the stars.
CaravanMeeting:
Your caravan has met peacefully with a caravan from {0}. The other caravan is composed of:

{1}
LetterCaravanRequest:
A nearby settlement, {0}, contacts you with a special trade request. They would like to purchase:

{1}

In return, they offer:

{2}

This request expires after: {3}

If you want to make the trade, send a caravan with the requested supplies. You can review this offer by selecting {0} on the world map.
CaravanDemand:
Your caravan has been ambushed by a group of {1} {3} from {0}. They will attack unless you give them:

{2}
ItemStashQuestFeeDemand: {0} is willing to tell us the location of the stash in exchange for {1} silver.
ItemStashSitePart_Unknown: Unfortunately, {0} has no idea who or what - if anything - might be guarding the stash.
ItemStashSitePart_Nothing: {0} says that the stash is unguarded.
ItemStashSitePart_Outpost: {0} says that there is an enemy outpost nearby.
ItemStashSitePart_Turrets: {0} says that the stash is surrounded by enemy turrets.
ItemStashSitePart_Manhunters: {0} says that there is a group of manhunting animals wandering nearby.
RecipeRequiresSkills: The recipe {0} requires the skills below. None of your colonists have these skills, so nobody will do this bill.
SelfTendTip: {0} with self-tend enabled will automatically tend to themselves on the spot at {1} the normal efficiency.
CannotTrainTooSmall: {0} is too small to train this.
FirstSummerWarning:
Summer has begun! But winter is coming.

Your food crops won't grow in the winter cold. Be sure to store several days' worth of food now, while you still can.

You can build a walk-in refrigeration room to prevent food from spoiling.

And try to buy, steal, or make some parkas, or you'll freeze when you step outside.
RelationsBrokenDown: Relations with {0} have broken down. They are now hostile to you.
RelationsWarmed: Relations have with {0} have warmed. They are no longer hostile to you.
RelationsBrokenCapture: Because you captured {0}, {1} is now your enemy.
ShortCircuitRain: A {0} has short-circuited in the rain and started a fire.
AreaRevealed: A new area has been revealed.
AreaRevealedWithMechanoids: A new area has been revealed. It contains ancient, hostile mechanoids.
RoofCollapsed: A roof has collapsed because it was too far from any support.
BirthdayChronological:
It's {0}'s chronological birthday today! Biologically, {1} is {3} years old.

Chronologically, {1} just turned {2}.

Note that since people don't age while in cryptosleep, chronological birthday is separate from biological birthday.
BirthdayBiologicalAgeInjuries:
{0} has reached the biological age of {1}.

Unfortunately, {0} has gained the following diseases due to aging:
{2}
NewDisease:
{0} has gotten sick from {1}.

Ensure you have a medical bed and a doctor. Make sure that {2} gets proper treatment and spends as much time in bed as possible.
NewPartDisease:
{0} has gotten sick from {3}. The infection is in HIS {1}.

Ensure you have a medical bed and a doctor. Make sure that {2} gets proper treatment and spends as much time in bed as possible.
AncientShrineWarning: As {0} draws near the ancient wall, a sense of foreboding overcomes HIM. HECAP isn't sure why, but HE feels that this dusty structure may contain great danger.
AnimalManhunterFromDamage: A {0} is attacking after being harmed!
AnimalManhunterFromTaming: A {0} is attacking due to a taming attempt!
AnimalManhunterOthers: Other {0}s nearby have also become enraged!
LetterFriendlyTrapSprung: {0} has accidentally sprung a trap and taken damage from it.
LetterHealthComplications:
{0} has developed a health condition:

{1}

This was caused by:

{2}
LetterLeaderChanged:
{0} is no longer {3} of {1}.

The new {3} is {2}.
LetterRelatedPawnsRaidEnemy:
There are people who have relationships with your colonists or prisoners in the arriving group of {0}.

Keep in mind that even though they are related, they will still attack each other because of their bad factions relations.

These people are:
LetterRelatedPawnsRaidFriendly: There are people who have relationships with your colonists or prisoners in the arriving group of friendly {0}:
LetterRelatedPawnsNeutralGroup: There are people who have relationships with your colonists or prisoners in the arriving group:
LetterRelatedPawnsTradeShip: The orbital trader is selling people who have relationships with your colonists or prisoners:
LetterRelatedPawnsTradingWithSettlement: The settlement is selling people who have relationships with your colonists or prisoners:
LetterRelatedPawnsTradingWithOtherCarava: The caravan is selling people who have relationships with your colonists or prisoners:
RelationshipAppendedLetterTextColonist: NAME has a relationship with a colonist. HECAP is {0}'s {1}.
RelationshipAppendedLetterTextPrisoner: NAME has a relationship with one of your prisoners. HECAP is {0}'s {1}.
LetterAffair: {0}, married to {1}, has begun an affair with {2}.
LetterNewLovers: {0} and {1} have come together and are now lovers.
LetterNoLongerLovers: {0} and {1} are no longer in a relationship.
LetterAcceptedProposal:
{1} has accepted {0}'s marriage proposal.

At some point in the coming days or seasons, they will have their marriage ceremony and invite all the colonists. Consider placing a marriage spot if you want to control where the ceremony occurs.
LetterRejectedProposal: {1} has rejected {0}'s marriage proposal. {0} is going to be unhappy about this.
LetterBondedAnimalDied: {0}, bonded to {1}, has died. It will affect {1}'s mood.
LetterNamedBondedAnimalDied: {0} named {1}, bonded to {2}, has died. It will affect {2}'s mood.
LetterBondedAnimalDiedMulti:
{0} has died. It will affect mood of the following people:

{1}
LetterNamedBondedAnimalDiedMulti:
{0} named {1} has died. It will affect mood of the following people:

{2}
LetterPrisonBreak:
Prisoners have staged a breakout! They've somehow defeated the door locks and are making their way out. They may seek weapons, fight, or try to escape. These prisoners are involved:

{0}

Prisoners are more likely to attempt breakout when they are numerous and healthy.
LetterNewParty: {0} is throwing a party! Everyone who goes will gain joy and social energy, and a lasting positive mood boost.
LetterNewlyAddicted:
{0} has developed an addiction to {1}.

HECAP now has a need for {1}, visible on HIS Needs tab. HECAP will automatically consume the drug to fulfil HIS need. If HE cannot get any {1}, HE will go into withdrawal.
LetterFormedCaravan: Your caravan has formed and awaits orders on the world map.
LetterAllCaravanColonistsDied: All members of your caravan have died.
LetterCaravanEnteredAmbushMap: {0} has arrived at the ambush site.
LetterCaravanEnteredEnemyBase: {0} has arrived at {1} and is ready to begin the attack.
LetterCaravanEnteredEnemyBaseBecameHosti:
{0} has arrived at {1} and is ready to begin the attack.

Because of your hostile approach, {2} is now hostile to you.
LetterFactionBaseDefeated:
The enemy outpost {0} has been destroyed.

You have {1} to collect items before your colonists reform the caravan.
LetterFactionBaseDefeated_FactionDestroy: This was the last base of {0}, which means the faction does not exist anymore.
LetterPawnsLostDueToMapCountdown:
Some of your animals or prisoners were left behind in the wilderness:

{0}
LetterDefeatAllEnemiesQuestCompleted:
You have defeated the enemy outpost!

The payment from {0} has arrived, and faction relations have improved by {1}.
CannotDoThisWork: {0} cannot do this kind of work.
IncapableOfWorkTypeBecauseOfCapacities: This colonist is not able to do any work of this type because of his health condition.
ResearchCostComparison: Project base cost {0} becomes {1} for you because of your tech level.
BindingButtonToolTip: Left-click to bind this key or right-click for options
PressAnyKeyOrEsc: Press any key or Esc to cancel...
HatsShownOnlyOnMap: Hats shown only on game map
AdaptiveTutorIsReset: Tutor is reset. You will be now be re-taught all lessons from scratch.
NamesYouWantToSee: Names of player-created characters you want to see:
TypeFirstNickOrLastName: Type the first name, nickname, or last name.
MessageAlreadyPreferredName: This name is already on the preferred list.
MaxPermadeathAutosaveIntervalInfo: Maximum autosave interval in permadeath mode is {0} day.
AboutHistoryUpload: Users gameplay data helps developers balance the game. If you agree, your information will be sent every {0} game days (and in some other rare cases like the end of the game) to the RimWorld server and then analyzed. Uploaded gameplay data consists only of statistics and history records related to the game - no personal information is sent, except for user name, which means it is completely anonymous.
PlanetCoverageTip: The planet is always the same diameter, but since itâ€™s far larger than needed for play, we donâ€™t generate the whole surface because it can take a very long time. This is the percentage of the surface that you want generated.
NoWorldsFilesFound: No world files found. Create a world first.
BuildNowAvailable: Version {0} is now available. Check ludeon.com for more info.
ConfirmDisableCoreMod:
Are you sure you want to disable the core mod? The game won't work at all unless you have another mod that replaces all the core functionality.

Remember, other mods can override defs in the core mod by using the same defName.
ConfirmDeleteMod: Are you sure you want to delete all the content for {0}?
ConfirmUnsubscribe: Are you sure you want to unsubscribe from {0}?
Author: Author
ModNotMadeForThisVersion: This mod was not made for this version of RimWorld, and will probably not work correctly.
MessageModNeedsWellFormattedTargetVersio: Mod needs a well-formatted target version in About.xml. Like this: <targetVersion>{0}</targetVersion>.
TextFieldsMustBeFilled: All text fields must be filled.
ConfirmSteamWorkshopUpload:
Are you sure you want to upload this to the Steam Workshop?

You must agree to the Steam Workshop terms of service. Find the full terms here:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/workshoplegalagreement
ConfirmContentAuthor:
Obviously you should only upload content that you created yourself.

Did you create this content yourself?
CanBeUpdatedOnWorkshop: Can be updated on Workshop, since you are the author.
HowStorytellersWork: The AI Storyteller creates events like pirate raids, resource drops, or animal attacks. Their choices will affect the story of your colony. You can change these settings at any time.
CannotLandBiome: You cannot land on this biome: {0}
CannotLandImpassableMountains: You cannot land on impassable mountains.
FactionBaseAdjacent: Settlements cannot be directly adjacent to each other.
FirstNameDesc:
The character's first name.

This is only displayed in certain menus.
ShortIdentifierDesc:
The character's short identifier.

This is displayed at all times. It can be the first or last name, or a completely separate nickname.
LastNameDesc:
The character's last name.

This is only displayed in certain menus.
ConfirmQuit: Really quit? You'll lose unsaved progress.
EveryoneNeedsValidName: Each person needs a valid name.
MessageSiegersAssaulting: Sieging {0} from {1} are assaulting the colony.
MessageRaidersDetectedEarlyAssault: {0} from {1} have detected you and begun their assault early.
MessageRaidersKidnapping: {0} from {1} have decided to kidnap who they can and leave.
MessageRaidersStealing: {0} from {1} have decided to steal what they can and leave.
MessageRaidersGivenUpLeaving: {0} from {1} have given up and are leaving.
MessageRaidersSatisfiedLeaving: {0} from {1} are satisfied with the damage done and are leaving.
MessageVisitorsTakingWounded: {0} from {1} are taking a wounded guest.
MessageVisitorsTrappedLeaving: {0} from {1} have been trapped and are digging out to escape.
MessageVisitorsDangerousTemperature: {0} from {1} are leaving the map because of dangerous temperature.
MessageWornApparelDeterioratedAway: {0} worn by {1} deteriorated away to nothing.
MessageNeedBeaconToTradeWithShip:
You need an orbital trade beacon to trade with a ship.

The beacon needs to be powered.
MessageOutOfNearbyShellsFor: {0} found no nearby unreserved shells for {1}.
MessageAnimalsGoPsychoHunted: Warning: {0}s will often attack when harmed.
MessageAnimalManhuntsOnTameFailed: Warning: {0}s may attack upon a failed taming attempt ({1} chance).
MessageTameAndNameSuccess: {0} successfully tamed {1} ({2} chance) and named HIM {3}.
MessageColonyCannotAfford: The colony cannot afford this deal.
MessageColonyNotEnoughSilver: You do not have enough silver ready to trade.
MessageMustDesignateHaulable: Must designate haulable items. Some items are always haulable and can't be designated.
MessageAlreadyInStorage: This is already in storage and will be moved to high-priority storage as necessary.
MessageMustDesignateStrippable: Must designate corpse or downed character with strippable apparel.
MessageMustDesignateSlaughterable: Must designate tame animal that belongs to the colony.
MessageMustDesignateOpenable: Must designate full graves or containers.
MessageNoMedicalBeds: There are no medical beds available.
MessageNoAnimalBeds: There are no animal beds available.
MessageTooLowMedCare: Operation requires {0} or better, but {1}'s current medical care mode is "{2}".
MessageNoLongerDowned: {0} is no longer incapable of walking.
MessageInvoluntarySleep: {0} has collapsed due to extreme exhaustion.
MessageMedicalOperationFailureMinor: {0} has failed in a minor way while operating on {1}.
MessageMedicalOperationFailureCatastroph: {0} has failed catastrophically while operating on {1}.
MessageMedicalOperationFailureRidiculous: {0} has failed in a ridiculous way while operating on {1}.
MessagePawnExitMapRelationsGain: Because {0} exited the map healthy, relations with {1} have improved by {2}.
MessageMiscarriedPoorHealth: {0} has miscarried due to poor health.
MessageNoHandlerSkilledEnough: No handler can tame {0} (requires level {1} in {2}, best handler {3} has {4}).
MessageHiveReproduced: A bug hive has reproduced itself.
MessageTraderCaravanLeaving: The trade caravan from {0} is leaving.
MessageSocialFight: {0} started a social fight with {1}. Reason: {2}.
MessageNewMarriageCeremony: Colonists are gathering to celebrate {0} and {1}â€™s marriage.
MessageMarriageCeremonyStarts: {0} and {1} are beginning their marriage ceremony!
MessageMarriageCeremonyCalledOff: The marriage ceremony for {0} and {1} has been called off.
MessageNewlyMarried: {0} and {1} have married. Colonists are now celebrating the occasion.
MessageMarriageCeremonyAfterPartyFinishe: The marriage ceremony for {0} and {1} has finished.
MessageNewBondRelationNewName: {0} and {1} have formed a bond. {0} has named HIM {2}.
MessageBondedAnimalMentalBreak: {0} has a mental break because of {1}'s death.
MessageNamedBondedAnimalMentalBreak: {0} named {1} has a mental break because of {2}'s death.
MessageBondedAnimalsMentalBreak: {0} animals have a mental break because of {1}'s death.
MessageShipChunkDrop: A chunk of a spacecraft has fallen from space and landed nearby.
MessagePartyCalledOff: The party has been called off.
MessageCannotSellItemsReason: Some items cannot be traded because of:
MessageConstructionFailed: {1} failed while constructing {0}. Some resources have been wasted.
MessageNoLongerSocialFighting: {0} and {1} are no longer social fighting.
MessageFailedToSendCaravanBecausePawnLos: Failed to send the caravan because one of the colonists, prisoners or animals has been lost.
MessageCaravanFormationPaused: The caravan formation process will continue when everyone recovers from a mental break.
MessageCaravanFormationUnpaused: Your colonists will now continue forming a caravan.
MessageCaravanMemberHasExtremeMentalBrea: One of the caravan members has a mental break.
MessageMaxPlanetCoveragePerformanceWarni: Warning: It can take a very long time to generate an entire planet.
MessagePlantDiedOfRot: {0} has died from rotting due to being left unharvested.
MessagePawnBeingBurned: {0} is being burned by superheated air!
MessagePawnLeftMapAndCreatedCaravan: {0} has left the area and formed a caravan.
MessageSettledInExistingMap: You have successfully settled in a new area.
MessageAmbushVictory: Victory! In {0}, the caravan will automatically be reformed. You can reform the caravan now in the World screen.
MessageAutomaticallyReformedCaravan: Your colonists have reformed the caravan.
MessageRescueeJoined: Since you rescued HIM, {0} has joined your group!
MessageAttackedCaravanIsNowHostile: Because you attacked a caravan of {0}, this faction is now hostile to you.
MessageFactionPawnCrushed: {0} lost people to a roof collapse. Faction relation: {1}
MessageTransportersNotAdjacent: All pod launchers connected to the selected transport pods must be adjacent.
MessageTransportersLoadCanceled_Transpor: The loading process has been canceled because one of the transport pods has been destroyed.
MessageTransportersLoadCanceled_FuelingP: The loading process has been canceled because one of the pod launchers has been destroyed.
MessageTransportersLoadingProcessStarted: Your colonists will now load the assigned items into the transport pods.
MessageTransportPodsArrivedAndLost: Your transport pods have arrived, but since there were no colonists inside, the contents are lost.
MessageTransportPodsArrivedAndAddedToCar: Your transport pods have arrived. The contents have been added to your caravan.
MessageFailedToLoadTransportersBecauseCo: The loading process has been canceled because one of the colonists has been lost.
MessageFinishedLoadingTransporters: Your colonists have finished loading the transport pods.
MessageTransportPodsDestinationIsTooFar: Each pod launcher would need at least {0}x chemfuel to send transport pods that far.
MessageCantAbandonLastColonist: You can't abandon the last colonist.
MessageCantEquipIncapableOfViolence: Cannot equip: {0} is incapable of violence.
MessageSlaughteringBondedAnimal: Because they are bonded, slaughtering {0} will make {1} unhappy.
MessageSelectOwnBaseToFormCaravan: To form a caravan, select your own colony or a site where you have people.
MessageScreenResTooSmallForUIScale: At this resolution and UI scale, the game interface would not fit on-screen. Please reduce UI scale or increase resolution.
MessageYouHaveToReformCaravanNow: You have to reform the caravan now. Everyone left behind will be abandoned.
MessageSelfTendUnsatisfied: To self-tend, {0} must also be assigned to Doctor work.
MessageCannotSelfTendEver: {0} is incapable of doing Doctor work, and so cannot ever self-tend.
MessageCantAddWaypointBecauseUnreachable: It's not possible to reach this tile from the last waypoint.
MessageCantAddWaypointBecauseLimit: You can't add more than {0} waypoints.
MessageCantDoExecutionBecauseNoWardenCap: None of your wardens is capable of violence. The execution won't be performed.
MessageSiteCountdownBecauseNoMoreEnemies: You have defeated all enemies. In {0}, the caravan will automatically be reformed.
MessageSiteCountdownBecauseNoEnemiesInit: In {0}, the caravan will automatically be reformed. You can reform the caravan now in the World screen.
GameStartDialog:
The three of you awake in your cryptosleep sarcophagi to the sound of sirens and ripping metal. You barely get to the escape pods before the ship is torn apart.

Some time later, you land on this unknown rimworld.

As pieces of the shredded starship fall around you, you start making plans to survive.
ChangeLanguageFromMainMenu: You can only change language from the options screen on the main menu.
MeatDesc: Raw butchered flesh. Can be cooked into meals, or eaten raw.
LeatherDesc: Tanned, dried, scraped skin. A good traditional material for making clothes and bags.
SetPodLauncherTargetFuelLevel:
Set target fuel level to {0}
Max distance: {1} tiles
CaravanDaysOfFoodRot: Days of food: {0}, rot in {1} days
CaravanMemberMentalBreak: Stopped because: {0} has a mental break.
ForceExitAndRemoveMapCountdownTip: Your colonists will automatically reform a caravan and leave this area after {0}.
ClickToSortByThisColumn: Click to sort by this column.
SelectNextInSquareTip:
Select next thing in same square.

Shortcut key: {0}

You can also do this by slowly clicking the same square again.
HostilityReponseTip: Change how to react to nearby enemies when the colonist is not drafted.
ShowLearningHelperWhenEmptyToggleButton:
Toggle visibility of the learning helper when it is empty.

The learning helper is always visible if there is a concept activated to be learned. This toggle makes it disappear when no concept is active.
ShowEnvironmentToggleButton:
Toggle the environment display.

Displays the beauty and room stats of the environment as would be perceived by a character standing where the mouse is pointing.
ShowColonistBarToggleButton:
Toggle colonist bar.

Displays icons and basic status for all colonists along the top of the screen.
AutoHomeAreaToggleButton: Toggle automatically expanding the home area around new constructions.
CategorizedResourceReadoutToggleButton: Toggle categorized mode on the resource readout.
ShowAnimalNamesToggleButton: Toggle displaying animal names for tame named animals.
LockNorthUpToggleButton: Lock the rotation of the camera so the north pole is always up.
ExpandingIconsToggleButton: Toggle displaying expanding icons instead of the regular icons for distant objects.
GameConditionsTip: Special conditions affecting the area right now.
NoStuffsToBuildWith: You have no usable materials from which to build this.
MustPlaceUnroofed: Cannot be placed under a roof.
MustPlaceHeadOnShipBeam: Must place with head attached to ship structural beam.
MustPlaceNextToHopperAccepter: Must be placed next to something that needs a hopper.
MustPlaceOnSteamGeyser: Must be placed directly on a steam geyser.
MustPlaceCoolerWithFreeSpaces: Both the hot and cold sides of the cooler must be exposed.
MustPlaceVentWithFreeSpaces: Both the sides must be exposed for air to pass through.
MustPlaceAdjacentStandable: Must be placed with standable space on all sides.
MustPlaceNearFuelingPort: Must be placed next to a pod launcher's fueling port.
CasketWarning:
Warning!

NAME is your last free-standing colonist! If you let HIM step into that casket, you may not be able to continue playing. Are you sure you want to proceed?
NeurotrainerUsed: {0} used {1} neurotrainer to go from level {2} to level {3}.
Title: Title
QualityDescription: An item's quality is how well-made it is.
GameOverEveryoneDead:
Everyone is dead or gone. This story is over.

Perhaps someone else will find a use for the ruins of this place.
GameOverShipLaunched:
You've launched the ship! These colonists escaped:

{0}
These colonists were left behind:

{1}
Your AI will now try to guide the ship to a safe place. It might find a prosperous planet for you in this system. Or, it may undertake a centuries-long journey to another star. It might even decide to hide under ice on an asteroid for a few thousand years, waiting for someone to build a new glitterworld here.

You'll find out when you wake up.
GameOverPlanetkillerImpact:
At near-lightspeed, the planetkiller weapon slammed into the ground with the force of a trillion hydrogen bombs. Like a water balloon shot with a rifle, this world liquified under the impact and sprayed its molten guts across the cosmos.

Part of {0} is now a small asteroid belt. The rest is a molten, radioactive hellscape, constantly rippling with kilometers-high planetquakes.

You did not survive.
GameOverArrivedAtJourneyDestination:
As you get on board the ship you are greeted by the crew with open arms. They seem to be glad they could take at least one more person with them.

These colonists escaped:

{0}
These colonists were left behind:

{1}
The AI will now try to guide the ship to a safe place. It might find a prosperous planet for you in this system. Or, it may undertake a centuries-long journey to another star. It might even decide to hide under ice on an asteroid for a few thousand years, waiting for someone to build a new glitterworld here.

As you enter the cryptosleep pod you hesitate for a moment and feel slightly uncertain about whether you can trust these people.

You'll find out when you wake up.
DeterioratingDueToLackOfMaintenance: Deteriorating due to lack of maintenance.
CompassTip: Shows the north direction. Click to rotate the camera so the north pole is up.
RoutePlannerButtonTip: Click to enter the planning mode where you can plan your journey and calculate distance between waypoints.
RoutePlannerUsingAverageTicksPerMoveWarn: Planning mode uses the default caravan speed. Your speed may vary.
RoutePlannerPressEscapeToReturnToCaravan: ESC: Return to the caravan formation dialog.
EstimatedTimeToThisWaypointFromPrevious: Est. time between this and the previous waypoint: {0}
WikiTip: Opens Web browser to see the RimWorld wiki and get help playing.
ScenPart_StatFactor: The stat "{0}" will be universally multiplied by {1}.
ScenPart_PawnsHaveHediff: {0} have a {1} chance to start with {2}.
ScenPart_SetNeed: {0} have a {1} chance to have their {2} set between {3} and {4}.
ScenPart_PawnsHaveTrait: {0} have a {1} chance to start with trait: {2}
ScenPart_OnPawnDeathExplode: Characters and creatures explode on death ({0}, radius {1}).
ScenPart_StartingPawnAgeMin: Your people will be at least {0} years old.
ScenPart_StartingPawnAgeMax: Your people will be at most {0} years old.
ScenPart_StartingPawnAgeRange: Your people will be between {0} and {1} years old.
LearnedMaxToday: Learned max today ({0}/{1}, further learning multiplied by {2})

Do you really want to abandon {0}?

Abandoned items vanish and can never be recovered.
AbandonItemTipExtraText: Abandoned items vanish and can never be recovered.
OpenSpecificTabButtonTip: Click to open a tab with more details.
